column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: WiseTech continued to raise the visibility of its female team members globally to highlight the opportunities at WiseTech to other women. WiseTech's content showcased WiseTech team members of all genders, seniorities and functions to inspire women considering joining the tech industry. Around International Women's Day, WiseTech profiled female WiseTech team members from around the world who shared their stories about why they chose a career in technology and how it can get more young women into tech careers.
column20: International Women's Day, female team member, career in technology

column6: Diversity of governance bodies and employees
column13: This year, WiseTech became a sponsor of the Women in IT Society of the University of New South Wales (UNSW) based in Sydney, Australia. The sponsorship includes career fairs, career guides and a mentoring program. The sponsorship allows WiseTech to raise its profile among female IT students and connect it with high-potential graduate talent.
column20: Women in IT Society, UNSW, career fair

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: WiseTech's work on D&I is guided by its D&I Principles and supported by an internal cross-functional working group that includes executive sponsors from its Senior Management Team. WiseTech's People & Remuneration Committee oversees D&I at WiseTech, including gender pay equity, gender diversity in the workforce and organisational practices supporting diversity and inclusion.
column20: D&I Principles, cross-functional working group, gender pay equity

column6: Ratio of basic salary and remuneration of women to men
column13: WiseTech has undertaken internal pay equity analysis since FY20 and lodged its annual gender data and metrics with the Australian Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA). WiseTech is focused on ensuring gender pay equity across roles. This year, WiseTech continued to provide transparency of pay budget review spending by gender for People Leaders as part of its pay review processes and allocated a dedicated budget to support leaders in addressing identified pay equity gaps.
column20: Pay equity analysis, gender data, pay budget

column13: WiseTech became a Workplace Program Partner of Pink Elephants, an Australian charitable organisation supporting early pregnancy loss and miscarriage. WiseTech hosted a panel discussion with Pink Elephants on pregnancy and infant loss awareness, exploring the prevalence of these types of loss and the deep and different ways they might impact a person.
column20: Pink Elephant, a charitable organisation, pregnancy loss

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: WiseTech continued its partnership with Grok Academy, an Australian not-for-profit educational organisation. Through this partnership, WiseTech annually contributes 1% of pre-tax profits to Grok Academy. Grok Academy's mission is to educate all learners in transformative computing knowledge, skills and dispositions, empowering them to meet challenges and seize future opportunities.
column20: Grok Academy, educational organisation, computing knowledge

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: WiseTech continued its long-standing support of the NCSS Summer School, a summer residential program in Sydney and Melbourne for senior high school students with a strong passion for computer science, which Grok Academy runs. WiseTech's sponsorship enables the program to run at low cost for students and their families and also involves WiseTech developers as industry mentors.
column20: NCSS Summer School, summer residential program, computer science

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: WiseTech partnered with Ripen, one of WiseTech's training providers, to collect and donate over 300 gifts and toys to St Vincent de Paul Society-operated refuges for women and children escaping domestic violence or experiencing homelessness.
column20: Ripen, St. Vincent de Paul, domestic violence

column6: Operations with local community engagement, impact assessments, and development programs
column13: WiseTech matched donations made by team members to charities providing humanitarian support in response to the war in Ukraine. During the period, WiseTech donated over $43,000 to the United Ukraine Appeal, matching the value of team member donations.
column20: Humanitarian support, donation, United Ukraine Appeal

column13: WiseTech aims to work collaboratively with suppliers to mitigate any modern slavery risks. Where WiseTech identifies risks or issues with potential or current third-party suppliers, it will take appropriate measures to ensure corrective actions are implemented that are consistent with its remediation plan.
column20: Modern slavery risk, third-party supplier, remediation plan

column6: New suppliers that were screened using social criteria
column13: WiseTech updated and rolled out its internal purchasing principles to key decision-makers in its business. These principles supplement the online training and remind all employees involved in procurement activities of WiseTech's modern slavery obligations and the expectation that its suppliers conduct their business in compliance with all applicable laws and regulations.

column13: WiseTech manages risks associated with cybersecurity threats via its Enterprise Risk Framework, in alignment with ISO 31000 (Risk Management). WiseTech's Information Security Risk Management Framework guides the assessment of risks and associated controls by systematically identifying potential threats and vulnerabilities, evaluating their potential impact on its organisation's assets, and determining the appropriate risk response strategies.
column20: Information Security Risk Management Framework, cybersecurity threat, ISO 31000

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: In FY23, WiseTech maintained its ISO 27001 information security management systems certification and achieved SOC 1 and SOC 2 attestations. WiseTech aligns with the NIST Cybersecurity Framework, OWASP and ACSC Essential Eight and with standards published by the Center for Internet Security (CIS). These highly regarded and globally recognised programs assure WiseTech's customers that there are appropriate controls in place to protect WiseTech and its customer data from unauthorised or inappropriate collection, retention, use, disclosure, modification or destruction.
column20: Information Security Risk Management System, ISO 27001, NIST Cybersecurity Framework

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: WiseTech ran cyber-attack simulations to test and improve its internal incident response processes. Together with annual business continuity planning, disaster recovery and crisis management simulations, this prepares WiseTech's teams for the many variations a cyber-attack may take.
column20: Cyber-attack simulation, internal incident response, business continuity planning

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: WiseTech conducted regular phishing awareness campaigns to provide staff with the knowledge to identify phishing via various avenues, including business emails. These campaigns complement WiseTech's security and data protection training, which is mandatory for all WiseTech employees and contractors.
column20: Phishing awareness, business email, data protection training

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: During Cybersecurity Awareness Month, WiseTech's Information Security team promoted awareness and guided team members on taking control of their online lives. It reaffirmed WiseTech's internal security policies, procedures, and relevant best practices.

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: WiseTech's Business Continuity Framework is designed to minimise the likelihood and impact of potential interruptions. It is focused on ensuring that maximum possible service levels are maintained and that WiseTech recovers from interruptions as quickly as possible.
column20: Business Continuity Framework, potential interruption, service level

column6: Substantiated complaints concerning breaches of customer privacy and losses of customer data
column13: WiseTech's Incident Management Procedure governs the logging, monitoring, escalation and resolution of incidents. Incident management plans and playbooks support the implementation of this process. Critical systems are tested regularly to ensure WiseTech can meet and respond to critical incidents.
